title: ‘I am not a Pakistani’, clarifies YouTuber Zara Dar, who quit PhD for OnlyFans - Hindustan Times
summary:
Zara Dar addresses misinformation about her that had spread since she posted a video stating that she was quitting her PhD for OnlyFans

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

YouTuber Zara Dar, known for quitting her PhD studies to pursue a career on OnlyFans, clarified misinformation regarding her heritage, asserting that she is American and not Pakistani.

  • Dropped out of her PhD to focus on being a full-time content creator on OnlyFans.
  • Clarified that she is of mixed background: American, Persian, Southern European, Middle Eastern, and Indian.
  • Addressed misconceptions regarding her name causing confusion with another influencer.
  • Stated she continues to share educational content on YouTube related to her engineering background.
“With all due respect, I am not Pakistani. I am American, born and raised.”

The event has sparked conversations about identity and the impact of social media on personal narratives.
newTitle: YouTuber Zara Dar Clarifies Misinformation About Her Background

title: South Korean opposition postpones decision to impeach acting president - CNA
summary:
South Korean Opposition Delays Impeachment Decision for Acting President Han Duck-soo

Publication Date: December 24, 2023

Source: Channel News Asia

The South Korean opposition has chosen to postpone a decision to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo, initially set for Christmas Eve, until December 26, allowing for further evaluation of the situation.

  • The opposition Democratic Party decided not to present an impeachment motion on December 24 as intended.
  • This decision followed Han’s refusal to enact special Bills aimed at investigating the impeached former president Yoon Suk Yeol.
  • Park Chan-dae, the party’s floor leader, expressed a desire to consider public sentiments before proceeding.
  • Yoon Suk Yeol faces allegations tied to an interim martial law declaration and corruption claims against his wife, Kim Keon Hee.
  • The impeachment process requires six favorable votes from the nine-member Constitutional Court.
“We have decided to exercise patience, taking into account the sentiments of the people, and wait until the 26th to determine whether our demands are met.” - Park Chan-dae

In summary, the Democratic Party's strategic delay reflects a careful approach to a highly contentious political situation in South Korea.
newTitle: South Korean Opposition Delays Impeachment Decision for Acting President Han Duck-soo

title: Mob justice replaces extrajudicial killings in Yunus-led interim govt in Bangladesh, stability hangs in balance - The Hindu
summary:
Mob Justice Sur replaces Extrajudicial Killings in Yunus-led Interim Govt in Bangladesh, Stability Hangs in Balance

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: The Hindu

In recent months, Bangladesh has experienced a surge in mob justice with incidents escalating after the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government. The interim government, led by Dr. Muhammad Yunus, has been unable to restore law and order amidst increasing violence.

  • Abdul Hai Kanu, a 78-year-old freedom fighter, was publicly humiliated and assaulted by a mob on December 22, highlighting the rise in mob justice.
  • Over 82 people were killed due to mob incidents in just four months under the interim government.
  • Despite police presence, fear among officers leads to reluctance in intervention during violent incidents.
  • The country has seen a sharp rise in robbery and muggings, with at least 10 killed in Dhaka alone during this period.
  • Human rights groups have reported a significant increase in fabricated legal cases during this time.
“We are deeply concerned about mob justice. Police are not intervening, leading people to believe they can act without police interference.” - Advocate Saidur Rahman

While mob violence has surged, there has been a noted decline in extrajudicial killings, previously rampant under the ousted regime. However, as political instability continues, the question of law and order remains critical in Bangladesh.
newTitle: Mob Justice Surges in Bangladesh Amid Political Turmoil

title: 'Like a battlefield': 12 killed in blast at Turkey's explosives plant - The Times of India
summary:
12 Killed in Explosion at Turkish Explosives Plant

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

An explosion at an explosives plant in Turkey has resulted in the tragic deaths of 12 individuals. The incident emphasizes the risks associated with the production of explosives.

  • The explosion occurred at a facility known for producing military-grade munitions.
  • Rescue operations are currently underway, with emergency services deployed to the site.
  • The cause of the explosion is under investigation, with authorities looking into safety protocols.
“Such incidents are a stark reminder of the dangers in handling explosive materials.”

In conclusion, this incident highlights the need for stringent safety measures in industries dealing with hazardous materials to prevent further tragedies.
newTitle: 12 Killed in Explosion at Turkish Explosives Plant

PhD aspirant to OnlyFans model: Who is Zara Dar, influencer whose career choice sparked a debate? - Deccan Herald
summary:
Zara Dar: From PhD Aspirant to OnlyFans Model

Date: 24 December 2024 IST

Zara Dar, a former PhD student from Texas, has made headlines by leaving her academic path to pursue a full-time career as an OnlyFans model, igniting discussions about modern career choices in the digital age.

  • Dar is known for her YouTube channel where she simplifies complex scientific theories.
  • She expressed that her decision to leave PhD studies feels like a gamble but offers greater personal freedom.
  • Dar aims to combine science with personal content on her OnlyFans, differentiating her from typical adult content creators.
  • She plans to use her earnings to support STEM projects and scholarships, emphasizing her commitment to education and empowerment.
“It was a tough decision to leave something I’ve worked so hard for, but ultimately, this path allows me to be more creative and in control of my future.” - Zara Dar

In conclusion, Zara Dar's shift to content creation represents a modern trend of professionals redefining career success beyond traditional academic paths.

title: Kathy Hochul faces calls to resign after Guatemalan migrant burns woman alive, Elon Musk says ‘she should be recalled’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kathy Hochul Faces Pressure to Resign Following Tragic Subway Incident

Publication Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

New York Governor Kathy Hochul is facing calls to resign after a tragic incident involving the death of a woman at the hands of an illegal Guatemalan immigrant aboard a subway train.

  • Hochul shared a post on social media about subway safety improvements on the same day of the incident.
  • Elon Musk and Rep. Ritchie Torres criticized her for the timing of her post.
  • The suspect, Sebastian Zapeta-Calil, 33, has been charged with murder and arson.
  • Local politicians and residents are calling for Hochul's resignation, citing her insensitivity.
“You may mean well, but being governor is just not for you.” - Dov Hikind

The incident has sparked widespread outrage and discussions on public safety in New York, raising questions about Hochul's leadership.
newTitle: Kathy Hochul Faces Pressure to Resign Following Tragic Subway Incident

title: Gay couple gets 100 years in jail for raping adopted sons, recording porn in 'house of horrors' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gay Couple Sentenced to 100 Years for Raping, Abusing Adopted Sons in 'House of Horrors'

Date: Dec 24, 2024 - Source: Hindustan Times

A US court sentenced a gay couple to 100 years in prison without parole for raping two special needs sons they adopted, sexually abusing them, recording pedophilic pornography, and offering the kids to their friends.

  1. The couple forced their adopted sons, now 12 and 10 years old, to have sex with them.
  2. They recorded the abuse and shared it with their friends.
  3. The abuse came to light after police discovered sexual abuse material uploaded to a Google account.
  4. The couple pleaded guilty to charges including aggravated sodomy, sexual exploitation of children, and child molestation.
"These two Defendants truly created a house of horrors and put their extremely dark desires above everything and everyone else." - Randy McGinley, District Attorney

The couple was arrested in 2022, and their victims have shown remarkable resilience throughout the case.
newTitle: Gay Couple Sentenced to 100 Years for Raping, Abusing Adopted Sons in 'House of Horrors'

title: 'Will behead…': Israel's ominous warning to ‘Houthi terrorist organisation’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Israel Warns Houthi Group, Admits to Hamas Leader's Killing

Date: Dec 24, 2024

Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz admitted on Monday that Israel killed Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Iran in July. In a warning to the Houthi group, Katz stated that Israel had 'defeated' other adversaries and would 'behead their leaders' just as they did with Haniyeh.

Katz's statement comes amid ongoing conflicts in the region, with Israel pounding Gaza and targeting Hezbollah in Lebanon. Iran-backed Houthis in Yemen have been attacking commercial shipping in the Red Sea, claiming to express solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza.

With inputs from Reuters

Read the full article here.
newTitle: Israel Warns Houthi Group, Admits to Hamas Leader's Killing

title: Founder says it’s okay to pay Indian workers less than Americans. Controversial post sparks debate - Hindustan Times
summary:
Founder says it’s okay to pay Indian workers less than Americans. Controversial post sparks debate

December 24, 2024 - Hindustan Times

Franco Pereyra, the COO of staffing agency Near, has ignited controversy with his remarks on paying overseas workers less than Americans, citing lower living costs as justification.

  • Pereyra's comments on LinkedIn suggest it's acceptable for global talent to earn less due to lower living costs and limited opportunities abroad.
  • He acknowledged that while some exploitation occurs, it is not inherently wrong to pay overseas workers less.
  • His statements have been widely shared on social media, leading to a heated debate about labor practices and pay equity.
  • Workers from countries like India and the Philippines are highlighted as particularly vulnerable to being treated as disposable labor.
  • Pereyra warns that both workers and companies suffer from high turnover rates resulting from exploitative labor practices.
“A lot of people get upset and say workers in Latin America, India, and the Philippines are being exploited... But paying less for overseas work is not inherently wrong.” - Franco Pereyra

The debate generated by Pereyra’s comments reflects broader issues in the global workforce regarding fair compensation and working conditions.
newTitle: Founder says it’s okay to pay Indian workers less than Americans. Controversial post sparks debate

title: Capable Of Striking Indian Bases In Andamans! Meet Pakistan’s Nuclear Missiles That Have Rattled The US & Alarmed New Delhi - EurAsian Times
summary:
Capable Of Striking Indian Bases In Andamans! Meet Pakistan’s Nuclear Missiles That Have Rattled The US & Alarmed New Delhi

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 Source: EurAsian Times

The article discusses the recent sanctions imposed by the United States on entities involved with Pakistan's long-range ballistic missile program, highlighting concerns about Pakistan's capability to strike targets well beyond South Asia, particularly the US.

  • The US imposed new sanctions on December 18, targeting four entities related to Pakistan’s missile program.
  • The sanctions come amidst fears that Pakistan might eventually develop the capability to reach targets outside of South Asia.
  • Pakistan's Shaheen-III and Ababeel missiles are highlighted as significant developments in its nuclear arsenal.
  • Concerns have been raised about Pakistan's collaboration with foreign firms to enhance its missile capabilities.
  • Experts argue that Pakistan's missile developments are primarily aimed at countering India.
“If these trend lines continue, Pakistan will have the capability to strike targets well beyond South Asia, including the United States, raising real questions about Pakistan’s intentions.” - Johnathan Finer

The ongoing development of Pakistan's missile capabilities has prompted serious discussions regarding its implications for regional and global security, particularly concerning US interests.
newTitle: Pakistan's Long-Range Missiles Raise Concerns for the US and India

Mossad agents claim Hezbollah had ‘exploding pagers’ for decades - DAWN.com
summary:
Mossad agents claim Hezbollah had ‘exploding pagers’ for decades

Published on: December 24th, 2024 | Source: Dawn

Two former Israeli intelligence agents disclosed that Hezbollah unknowingly utilized Israeli-made walkie-talkies and pagers rigged with explosives, resulting in a catastrophic surprise attack in September 2024. The agents detailed how Mossad deceived Hezbollah into purchasing over 16,000 devices.

  • On September 17, 2024, thousands of pagers exploded simultaneously across Lebanon, causing widespread panic and casualties.
  • Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu later acknowledged Israel's involvement in the attacks.
  • Mossad concealed explosives within the devices, ensuring they inflicted minimal collateral damage.
  • The operation aimed to create fake companies to sell the modified devices without linking them back to Israel.
  • Hezbollah purchased 5,000 booby-trapped pagers, which were detonated remotely when requisite.
“We have an incredible array of possibilities of creating foreign companies that have no way being traced back to Israel,” said one agent.

This revelation underscores the lengths to which intelligence agencies might go in modern warfare, blending technology and deception.
newTitle: Mossad Agents Reveal Hezbollah's Use of Booby-Trapped Communications

“The Canal is not just a physical passage; it represents decades of negotiation and international relations.”

title: Bystanders accused of looking on and doing nothing as Guatemalan migrant set woman on fire, ‘Nobody came to her aid’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bystanders accused of looking on and doing nothing as Guatemalan migrant set woman on fire, ‘Nobody came to her aid’

Date: Dec 24, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

The incident occurred on December 22, where a Guatemalan migrant allegedly set a woman on fire aboard a Brooklyn subway train while bystanders did nothing to help.

  • Footage shows at least three people present, with one filming the event while a police officer stood by.
  • Suspect Sebastian Zapeta-Calil, 33, was arrested and charged with first- and second-degree murder and arson.
  • Community activists are expressing outrage at the bystanders' inaction, citing fear of involvement in legal issues.
  • Calls for accountability from the transit agency have been made following this incident.
  • Curtis Sliwa, a community leader, highlighted the chilling effect of recent legal cases on potential rescuers.
“Nobody came to her aid,” said Guardian Angels founder Curtis Sliwa.

In light of this event, discussions surrounding public safety and community responsibility are underway, with significant concerns about criminal activity and the role of bystanders.
newTitle: Bystanders Criticized for Inaction in Brooklyn Subway Fire Incident

summary:
Israel Claims Responsibility for Killing Hamas Leader Ismail Haniyeh in Iran

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a significant escalation of tensions, Israel has publicly acknowledged its role in the killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh during an operation in Iran back in July.

  • Israel's Prime Minister confirmed the operation was aimed at disrupting Hamas activities.
  • This move marks a rare admission by Israel regarding operations carried out on foreign soil.
  • The killing of Haniyeh raises questions about Iran's involvement and the broader implications for Middle Eastern geopolitics.
"This act demonstrates our commitment to fighting terrorism, no matter where it strikes." - Israeli Prime Minister

The acknowledgment of this operation by Israel signals a potential shift in its approach to targeting high-profile terrorist figures beyond its immediate borders.

title: Watch: Scared North Korean Soldiers Run Helter-Skelter As Ukraine’s Kamikaze Drones Chase Them In Russia’s - News18
summary:
North Korean Soldiers Panic as Ukrainian Drones Target Them in Russia

Publication Date: December 24, 2024, Source: News18

North Korean troops are currently under threat from Ukrainian kamikaze drones in Russia's Kursk region, as evidenced by viral videos capturing the chaos. Reports indicate a significant number of casualties among North Korean soldiers sent to fight in Ukraine.

  • Ukrainian drones have been observed circling and targeting North Korean soldiers.
  • South Korea reported that one in ten North Korean soldiers in Ukraine has already been killed or wounded.
  • At least 100 North Korean troops are confirmed to have died since December.
  • South Korean intelligence suggests North Korea is manufacturing drones and supplying military equipment to Russia.
  • Military cooperation between North Korea and Russia has intensified since the onset of the Ukraine conflict.
“Through various sources of information and intelligence, we assess that North Korean troops who have recently engaged in combat with Ukrainian forces have suffered around 1,100 casualties.” - South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff

This incident showcases the ongoing complexities of the Russia-Ukraine conflict and highlights the involvement of North Korean forces.
newTitle: North Korean Soldiers Panic as Ukrainian Drones Target Them in Russia

title: Santa Cruz wharf in California collapses in Pacific storm; 3 fall into ocean | Video - Hindustan Times
summary:
Santa Cruz Wharf Collapses During Pacific Storm; Three Rescued

Date: Dec 24, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A section of the Santa Cruz wharf in California collapsed during a major storm, leading to the rescue of two individuals while a third managed to swim to safety. The storm is expected to bring hurricane-force winds and hazardous surf conditions.

  • The collapse occurred at approximately 12:45 PM local time, with about 150 feet of the wharf falling into the ocean.
  • Two people were rescued by lifeguards with no serious injuries reported.
  • The section of the wharf had been closed for repairs from previous storm damage and included facilities like restrooms and a restaurant.
  • Residents were warned to avoid low-lying beach areas and evacuations were ordered for nearby ocean-facing hotels.
  • This incident comes a year after another local pier was destroyed by similar winter storms.
“The area will remain closed indefinitely due to hazards posed by debris,” said Santa Cruz officials.

The storm is predicted to continue affecting California's central coast with ocean swells and hazardous conditions along the West Coast.
newTitle: Santa Cruz Wharf Collapses During Pacific Storm; Three Rescued
